name: cyberark-aim
label: CyberArk AIM
description: CyberArk Application Identity Manager (AIM) is a key component in CyberArk's Privileged Access Security suite. It helps manage and secure credentials used by applications and services by providing secure retrieval of passwords and other sensitive data.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: URL of the CyberArk server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.tooltip: URL of the CyberArk server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Application ID
fields.name: AppID
fields.description: Application ID that has been issued to you by CyberArk, which is used for the password retrieval process.See the "Creating an application in CyberArk" section for the procedure on how to create an application in CyberArk.
fields.tooltip: Application ID that has been issued to you by CyberArk, which is used for the password retrieval process.See the "Creating an application in CyberArk" section for the procedure on how to create an application in CyberArk.

fields.title: Safe Name
fields.name: Safe
fields.description: Name of the Safe that stores the credentials, including passwords.
fields.tooltip: Name of the Safe that stores the credentials, including passwords.

fields.title: Authentication Type
fields.name: auth_type
fields.description: Specify the type of authentication of the CyberArk server to which you will connect and perform automated operations. By default, this option is set as "No Auth".
fields.tooltip: Specify the type of authentication of the CyberArk server to which you will connect and perform automated operations. By default, this option is set as "No Auth".
